title: Victony
author: Victony
content: Most persons may say no but YES is the actual answerIn the ideal sense the dominance of crypto currencies by women is in great progress. Bitcoin is  the most popular crypto currency and therefore a currency of such will be dominated either now or in the future.Women engage in crypto currency transactions also like men do the reason you may feel they don't is because those that don't have not much idea about it.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Women may not necessarily get too much involvements in cryptocurrencies because of the associated risk in so many of them, but in bitcoin which i know well about, i believe women have been into it for a while now and why it seems not too visible for many to know this is because they aren't interested in gender base when it comes to bitcoin since it's a p2p network, but i can tell you I've been on a several encounters with women buying from me on p2p just from their names being displayed i know they are women.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Victony on April 05, 2023, 04:22:43 PMMost persons may say no but YES is the actual answerIn the ideal sense the dominance of crypto currencies by women is in great progress. Bitcoin is  the most popular crypto currency and therefore a currency of such will be dominated either now or in the future.Women engage in crypto currency transactions also like men do the reason you may feel they don't is because those that don't have not much idea about it.There is no restriction placed on women from engaging in Bitcoin trading. There are many women in the stock market and other trading sectors, so Bitcoin will not be an exception. But as much as I know more men are involved in Bitcoin than women in my country. This might be because of a lack of information and cultural barrier. In my country, women suffer from discrimination because of our culture. Most women don't have access to phones or the internet because our society feels that they might use it as a medium to engage in immoral activities. While the men have unlimited access to phones and information. This condition has limited the interest of women in the Bitcoin sector.

comments.author: panganib999
comments.body: In my few short years as a cryptocurrency builder and trader all at the same time, I have had my fair share of females who dabble in the cryptocurrency world, and truthfully speaking, none of them are in passive roles like "trading". Most of them take up executive roles in startups which is something that is both inspiring and intimidating sometimes. I've taught a couple women too on how to trade cryptocurrencies in the past few years so there's that. The industry is pretty much riddled with males as much as females. It's just that the anonymity this industry boasts of is also acting as a form of double-edged sword that disallows women to get proper credit for their work sometimes, lest they risk being doxxed and having all their information released on the internet without their consent.

comments.author: indah rezqi
comments.body: OP, if you are happy to read some facts about women's involvement in crypto trading, then this one thread I think is suitable for your reference. There are survey results cited in the thread, there confirming that the dominance of women in trade is quite high compared to men.Quote from: pawel7777 on March 29, 2023, 09:27:20 PM"Singaporean women ‘outperforming’ men in crypto trades, survey reveals"https://cointelegraph.com/news/singaporean-women-outperforming-men-in-crypto-trades-survey-revealsThe dawn of mankind is officially here. A recent poll from Singapore revealed that women managed to outperform men in the manliest games of all - crypto trading:"As per the survey data, 76% of women reported either making money or breaking even on their crypto investments, compared to just 72% of men"Since it looks like the answers were self-reported, there's a chance that women may not be telling the truth, to make themselves look better. But maybe there's something in the female approach to trading that would explain it (i.e. higher risk aversion?).Link to the original survey: https://www.independentreserve.com/blog/news/independent-reserve-cryptocurrency-index-irci-singapore-2023There's a downloadable pdf, they're asking for name/email but don't verify, so you can put anything.It is also good to think that gender will not prevent you from getting involved in crypto trading, in fact there are many women who have been part of the team of a project till date. That is a fact although I am not too sure about the domination.

comments.author: thecodebear
comments.body: Of course women do. Though they have been slower to get in than men. In the early years most people who knew about Bitcoin were probably either in tech of finance. And those fields consist mostly of men. Also men tend to just by nature have a higher risk tolerance than women. For these reasons much more men are in Bitcoin/Crypto than women. Also some women have kind of got it in their head that crypto is a male thing simply because the early adoption was so heavily favored by men, so there are definitely some women out there who avoid it because they think it is some weird thing that only men get involved with, which is too bad for those women.There are plenty of women in crypto, and the ratio will even out over time as it goes more mainstream in the next couple decades. But for now it is still mostly men because adoption is still very early and few people even know what Bitcoin is so it still heavily favors the tech/finance/risk-okay people which are mostly men. But every year for now on this dominance of men should become less and less prevalent.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: If you ask me, then yes, the reality is that there are women involved in crypto. I have a couple of women friends whom I met online, and they are involved in crypto trading. There is no clear data on how many women are involved in crypto. Most probably, centralized exchanges would have some clear data since they verify identity. In a little search over the internet, I found that 26% of crypto users are women. But this data is not accurate; it's just a survey that was conducted by Gemini exchange. However, I assume that the actual number of women crypto users overall would be less.
